stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on finishing the Part-1 overworld: re-texturing the volcanic sector, prototyping a new combiner shader, and designing a permanent "volcano erupts" world-event that introduces a bully boss and later turns him into an NPC with a rhythm-singing minigame.

development_findings.summary: Chat suggestion led to a permanent "volcano erupts" event after the player beats the rising-lava secret; lava flows into area 1, forms a stone platform, and changes the overworld state.
development_findings.quote: Yes! The island goes through permanent change as you're on it.

development_findings.summary: The eruption sequence will be triggered at a specific star count (mentioned counts 8, 14, 21, 30 for overworld event stars).
Inside the volcano the player will fight a bully boss (initially vanilla mechanics, possibly with a small twist such as a wobbly platform).
development_findings.quote: I’m thinking just a normal bully boss fight at the end of the rising lava level… we can add a slight twist, not too much.

development_findings.summary: After eruption the same bully reappears in the overworld wearing corks on his horns and a floaty; he has ‘cooled down’ and becomes an NPC.
development_findings.quote: He says he’s chilled out and wants to make an honest living now.

development_findings.summary: Settled on giving the bully a simple rhythm-singing minigame; Mario presses B/A/Z for pitches, match timing, receive a star.
development_findings.quote: It would be a very simple minigame… it’s gonna take me an hour or two at most.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a ‘rescale combiner’ shader that lets primitive / shade colours control texture detail, enabling smooth detail fade on mountain walls.
development_findings.quote: I call this the rescale combined alpha combiner… we can change shade colour to get more or less detail.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 exporter currently inserts black geometry and breaks opacity; lighthouse and some decals cannot be finalised until the tool is fixed.
development_findings.quote: This is a Fast64 bug… I have to fix Fast64.

development_findings.summary: Mountain walls now use two textures: darker volcanic rock near the summit and grassy or weathered rock near water; grass tufts will be added later for cracks.
New path layout keeps sharp 90-degree cliff edges for gameplay collision despite art concerns.
development_findings.quote: We need the sharp 90-degree connection; without it, gameplay-wise it just wouldn’t work.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prefers working in silence but plays music when chat asks; jokes about being a ‘Grant Kirkhope hater’ after learning he didn’t compose DKR OST.
context_findings.quote: I used to not listen to music at all and just work in silence like a psychopath.

context_findings.summary: Displays a pragmatic philosophy: art must make the player feel something; dismisses projects he views as soulless (e.g., Yooka-Laylee).
context_findings.quote: The purpose of any art piece is to make you feel something… Yooka-Laylee didn’t feel like it had any feeling it was going for.

context_findings.summary: Mentions minor personal life: stomach ache, purchasing aquarium plants via Facebook Marketplace, benches 315 lbs (humorous aside).
Expresses concern about AI ‘glazing’ users with compliments and future misinformation.
context_findings.quote: I think five years from now we’ll have whole real-life catastrophes that don’t actually exist; people will just believe they exist because the internet tells them.

biobak.summary: Provides ongoing feedback on textures and environmental polish; Kaze defers final visual pass to him and is open to Biobak reworking areas he dislikes.
biobak.quote: If you think it sucks, you might be right on the money… Biobak will polish it up and make it look better.

zeina.summary: Only brief mention; Kaze jokes that he hopes Zeina won’t ‘knock out’ the plant delivery man, indicating a casual, supportive presence off-stream.

key_stories.title: Birth of the Volcano Eruption Event
key_stories.summary: A chat remark about having the volcano erupt sparks a full design discussion. Kaze outlines the cutscene, lava path, and resulting overworld transformation.
key_stories.challenge: Overworld felt static once the secret level was cleared.
key_stories.process: Brain-stormed live with chat, mapping lava flow, platform placement, and timing tied to star count.
key_stories.outcome: Committed to a permanent eruption event and began adjusting terrain height to accommodate lava.
key_stories.key_quote: The island goes through permanent change as you’re on it.

key_stories.title: Bully’s Redemption Arc
key_stories.summary: Kaze repurposes a lava bully boss into an overworld NPC who has ‘cooled down,’ wears a floaty, and runs a rhythm minigame.
key_stories.challenge: Needed an overworld star reward that felt alive, not just a repeat fight.
key_stories.process: Iterated through ideas (demolition service, tiki bar) before settling on singing minigame.
key_stories.outcome: Design documented; Kaze estimates coding will take 1–2 hours.
key_stories.key_quote: His dream was always to be a singer… when you play the song well enough he thanks you with a star.

key_stories.title: Shader Breakthrough: Rescale Combiner
key_stories.summary: While searching for better mountain visuals, Kaze invents a combiner that fades texture detail based on vertex colour.
key_stories.challenge: Mountain texture looked noisy near camera and flat at distance.
key_stories.process: Created new combiner in Fast64, adjusted primitive and shade colours to control detail density.
key_stories.outcome: Adopted for volcanic walls, improving texel density and transition.
key_stories.key_quote: We can change shade colour to get more or less detail – almost like a level of detail.
